intro: Xiphotheca reflexa, commonly known as the reflexed xiphotheca, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of southern Africa. It is a perennial shrub characterized by its upright growth habit and dense foliage. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color, which bloom during the warmer months. Xiphotheca reflexa thrives in well-drained soils and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. Its botanical features make it an attractive addition to gardens and a subject of interest for botanists studying South African flora.
